title: Who is the worst president of the 19th century? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I will tell you the 10 worst President of 19th century. 10. Benjamin Harrison Born: Aug. 20, 1833Died: March 13, 1901Presidential Term: 1889 - 1893Vice President: Levi Morton The grandson of former President William Henry Harrison, Benjamin Harrison's economic policies are believed to have contributed to the Panic of 1893.  9. Chester A. Arthur Born: Oct. 5, 1829Died: Nov. 18, 1886Presidential Term: 1881 - 1885Vice President: None Arthur is one of only a handful of American leaders who did not win a presidential election at the top of his party's ticket.  8. Herbert Hoover Born: Aug. 10, 1874Died: Oct. 20, 1964Presidential Term: March 4, 1929 - March 4, 1933Vice President: Charles Curtis Hoover was known as a poor communicator who fueled trade wars and exacerbated the Great Depression.  6. (Tie) John Tyler Born: March 29, 1790Died: Jan. 18, 1862Presidential Term: April 4, 1841 - March 4, 1845Vice President: None He was a stalwart defender of slavery who abandoned his party's platform once he was president.  6. (Tie) Millard Fillmore Born: Jan. 7, 1800Died: March 8, 1874Presidential Term: July 9, 1850 - March 4, 1853Vice President: None He backed the Compromise of 1850 that delayed the Southern secession by allowing slavery to spread.  5. William Henry Harrison Born: Feb. 9, 1773Died: April 4, 1841Presidential Term: March 4, 1841 - April 4, 1841Vice President: John Tyler Delivering the longest inaugural address in U.S. history, he came down with pneumonia that made his 30-day presidency the shortest in U.S. history.  4. Warren G. Harding Born: Nov. 2, 1865Died: Aug. 2, 1923Presidential Term: March 4, 1921 - Aug. 2, 1923Vice President: Calvin Coolidge Harding was an avid golfer and poker player whose administration is perhaps best remembered for its litany of corruption and scandals.  3. Franklin Pierce Born: Nov. 23, 1804Died: Oct. 8, 1869Presidential Term: March 4, 1853 - March 4, 1857Vice President: William R. King Pierce's fervor for expanding the borders – thereby adding several slave states – helped set the stage for the Civil War.  2. Andrew Johnson Born: Dec. 29, 1808Died: July 31, 1875Presidential Term: April 15, 1865 - March 4, 1869Vice President: None Johnson survived impeachment after opposing Reconstruction initiatives, including the 14th amendment.  1. James Buchanan Born: April 23, 1791Died: June 1, 1868Presidential Term: March 4, 1857 - March 4, 1861Vice President: John Breckinridge He refused to challenge either the spread of slavery or the growing bloc of states that became the Confederacy.  “If you like then upvote as it matters” For errors or suggestions please do comment Thank you ✍️ Shwetank Dixit

I would say James Buchanan, the one right before Lincoln. While he was a lame duck president, southern states were leaving the union, and he took no action. Had he taken decision action like “Action” Jackson did when SC tried to start that under his watch, the Civil War might have been prevented.
